title: Kentucky Banana Pudding Recipe
description: This banana pudding is made with evaporated milk and features a crust of vanilla wafers topped with creamy pudding and a layer of sliced bananas.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Fruit Desserts Banana Dessert Recipes Kentucky Banana Pudding 4.5 (171) 141 Reviews 28 Photos This banana pudding made with evaporated milk is my grandmother's recipe. This version has a cookie crust. Submitted by Melly Neel Updated on March 26, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 28 28 28 28 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Additional Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 40 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 1 ½ cups milk 1 cup white sugar ¼ cup cornstarch 1 egg, beaten 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 1 (12 ounce) package vanilla wafers 4 banana, sliced Directions Combine evaporated milk, milk, sugar, cornstarch, and egg in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until thick. Remove pudding from heat; add vanilla and mix well. Arrange a layer of wafers in a large bowl or casserole dish. Pour pudding over wafers and top with banana slices. Refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour. I Made It Print 299 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 461 Calories 13g Fat 79g Carbs 8g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 461 % Daily Value * Total Fat 13g 17% Saturated Fat 5g 26% Cholesterol 41mg 14% Sodium 207mg 9% Total Carbohydrate 79g 29% Dietary Fiber 2g 9% Total Sugars 39g Protein 8g 16% Vitamin C 6mg 7% Calcium 194mg 15% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 479mg 10% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Kentucky Banana Pudding 01 of 28 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 28 Photo by  dbuck19 07/27/2021 My wife loves this Banana Pudding. I used Chessman cookies this time just for her. 03 of 28 Photo by  Stephanie 10/03/2020 I have made this several times. I use a 9x13 pan. I double the pudding recipe, use 7 bananas, use 1 1/4 pkgs of nila wafers. I also put enough lemon juice on the bananas to make sure they don't discolor. For the whipped topping, i use heavy whipping cream. I use 16 oz, 1/2 tsp tartar(helps stabilize the topping), 1/4-1/2 cup powdered sugar and 1tsp of vanilla extract. Make sure to heat the mixture and dissolve the sugar in the milk(i just used whole milk not evaporated) before adding the egg. I Reserve 1/2 cup of milk to mix with the cornstarch. Then i add the egg when the mixture is warm. Don't let the mixture to hot before adding the egg or y'all get scrambled eggs. Then, i add the cornstarch/milk mixture to the rest. Whisking vigorously until it becomes thick. I usually make the pudding a day before that way it's not hot when prepping it. It was such a great recipe. 04 of 28 Photo by  Stephanie 10/03/2020 I have made this several times. I use a 9x13 pan. I double the pudding recipe, use 7 bananas, use 1 1/4 pkgs of nila wafers. I also put enough lemon juice on the bananas to make sure they don't discolor. For the whipped topping, i use heavy whipping cream. I use 16 oz, 1/2 tsp tartar(helps stabilize the topping), 1/4-1/2 cup powdered sugar and 1tsp of vanilla extract. Make sure to heat the mixture and dissolve the sugar in the milk(i just used whole milk not evaporated) before adding the egg. I Reserve 1/2 cup of milk to mix with the cornstarch. Then i add the egg when the mixture is warm. Don't let the mixture to hot before adding the egg or y'all get scrambled eggs. Then, i add the cornstarch/milk mixture to the rest. Whisking vigorously until it becomes thick. I usually make the pudding a day before that way it's not hot when prepping it. It was such a great recipe. 05 of 28 Photo by  tiffanyandjohnk 08/14/2020 06 of 28 Photo by  Pamela Parker Ciardullo 05/28/2020 07 of 28 Photo by  tina 05/15/2020 08 of 28 Photo by  Gabyjane 05/13/2020 I added 1 5.9 ounce box of instant banana cream pudding mix and 1/2 cup of organic unsweetened nondairy almond beverage. I also ground up the vanilla wafers and added some butter to make a crust for the bottom layer. 09 of 28 Photo by  Evangelina Torres 05/10/2020 Definitely making this again!!! 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Banana Pudding with Meringue 67 Ratings Southern-Style Baked Banana Pudding 62 Ratings Sinful Banana Pudding 28 Ratings Creamy Banana Pudding 250 Ratings Aunt Betty's Banana Pudding 222 Ratings Bananas Foster Pudding 26 Ratings Skinny Foster 14 Ratings Chef John's Bananas Foster 33 Ratings Bananas Foster 1,132 Ratings Grandma's Banana Pudding 11 Ratings Roasted Banana Whiskey Ice Cream 6 Ratings Banana Coconut Pudding or Pie Filling 3 Ratings Kentucky Bourbon Cake 28 Ratings Chocolate Pudding Popsicles 8 Ratings Banana Oatmeal Raisin Pudding 3 Ratings Extra Special Banana Pudding 29 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Melly Neel
instructions: Combine evaporated milk, milk, sugar, cornstarch, and egg in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until thick. Remove pudding from heat; add vanilla and mix well.;Arrange a layer of wafers in a large bowl or casserole dish. Pour pudding over wafers and top with banana slices. Refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour.
